TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Toolset extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represent an aggregation of a tools version (eg. "2.0"), tools path, and optional set of associated properties.

remarks.format: ## Remarks UNDONE: (danmose) Review immutability. If this is not immutable, add a mechanism to notify the project collection/s owning it to increment their toolsetVersion.

Docs.summary: Creates a toolset with the given tools version and tools path. Global, reserved, and environment properties are taken from the given project collection.

MemberSignature.Value: public string DefaultSubToolsetVersion { get; }
.property instance string DefaultSubToolsetVersion
Public ReadOnly Property DefaultSubToolsetVersion As String
public: property System::String ^ DefaultSubToolsetVersion { System::String ^ get(); };
member this.DefaultSubToolsetVersion : string

Docs.summary: Gets the default sub toolset version for this toolset.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If [!INCLUDE[vs_dev10_long](~/includes/vs-dev10-long-md.md)] is installed, use the base toolset and return a sub toolset version of "10.0".
Otherwise, use the highest-versioned sub toolset found. Sub toolsets with numbered versions are ordered numerically; any additional sub toolsets are prepended to the beginning of the list in the order found. Returns null if there is no sub toolset available and [!INCLUDE[vs_dev10_long](~/includes/vs-dev10-long-md.md)] is not installed.

Docs.summary: Creates the sub toolset version to be used with this toolset.

MemberSignature.Value: public string GenerateSubToolsetVersion ();
.method public hidebysig instance string GenerateSubToolsetVersion() cil managed
Public Function GenerateSubToolsetVersion () As String
public: System::String ^ GenerateSubToolsetVersion();
member this.GenerateSubToolsetVersion : unit -> string

Docs.summary: Creates the sub toolset version to be used with this toolset.
Docs.returns: The sub toolset version to be used with this toolset.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If "VisualStudioVersion" is set as a property on the toolset itself, then sub toolset version is set to "VisualStudioVersion".
Otherwise, sub toolset version is set to the DefaultSubToolsetVersion of the toolset.

MemberSignature.Value: public string GenerateSubToolsetVersion (System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<string,string> overrideGlobalProperties, int solutionVersion);
.method public hidebysig instance string GenerateSubToolsetVersion(class System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2<string, string> overrideGlobalProperties, int32 solutionVersion) cil managed
Public Function GenerateSubToolsetVersion (overrideGlobalProperties As IDictionary(Of String, String), solutionVersion As Integer) As String
public: System::String ^ GenerateSubToolsetVersion(System::Collections::Generic::IDictionary<System::String ^, System::String ^> ^ overrideGlobalProperties, int solutionVersion);
member this.GenerateSubToolsetVersion : System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<string, string> * int -> string

Docs.param: Set of global properties to use to create the sub toolset version. May be null.
The solution version to use to create the sub toolset version.
Docs.summary: Creates the sub toolset version to be used with this toolset.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the "VisualStudioVersion" global property exists in the set of global properties passed in, then sub toolset version is set to "VisualStudioVersion".
Otherwise, if "VisualStudioVersion" is set as a property on the toolset itself, then sub toolset version is set to "VisualStudioVersion".
Otherwise, if the Visual Studio version corresponding to the solution version (Visual Studio version = solution version - 1) passed in maps to an existing sub toolset, then sub toolset version is set to the Visual Studio version.
Otherwise, sub toolset version is set to the DefaultSubToolsetVersion of the toolset.

Docs.param: The sub toolset version of the sub toolset. May be .
Docs.summary: Gets property specified by the given property name and sub toolset version.
Docs.returns: The property specified, or if not found.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the property is not found in the sub toolset, searches for the property in the base toolset.
If the property is not found in the sub toolset or the base toolset, returns null.
